Status:

Allen’s status:

Couldn’t make scrum as he was attending a meeting with the membership services squad today. Status: Attempted to recreated eventHub issue on ZACI v0.6. Also he has a nascent docker implementation of block chain network setup for fabric-node-sdk repo for test. Needs help with sync processing.

Anya’s status:

Couldn’t make scrum today as I was taking my cat to the vet to get neutered :scream:. Status: I had published the updated v0.6.3 hfc package to npm. Met with Patrick to discuss the event integration work, will probably meet once again today to continue discussion. Researched the possibilities of persisting eventHub connection metadata in either MongoDB or Redis. Both seem like very good options, depending on what exactly we are trying to store, will need more info to understand what exactly will need to be stored.
Running 'make all' against feature/consensus, and I am seeing this:

Running go vet
go vet ./consensus/...
go vet ./core/...
core/committer/noopssinglechain/committer.go:149: no formatting dntf call
exit status 1
make: *** [linter] Error 1
ibmadmin@jcwNodeSDK:~/work/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric$
you mean feature/convergence?
yep :blush: I should have said feature/covergence
interesting… i haven’t tried that yet today
I will write it up as an issue.  I guess I should 'make images' 'make peer', make membersrvc to see if I can work around it?
<@U1AJV5S2G> this is fixed in the merge work that’s being done (<@U0KPFAZNF>)
When will the new version be available for cloning?
we are working on it as we speak
but to your point, its surprising its not showing up in all envs … it’ll be good tun this to earth
<@U11HH3P7Y> I opened <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-746> to add code coverage via Istanbul to the CI job. please let me know if you have any questions. thanks
sure... Jenkins doesn't have sudo access to install this globally.. Will check with ry

<@U11HH3P7Y> you can get around npm global install requiring sudo by following these two steps:
- npm config set prefix ~/npm (or any other folder in the HOME directory)
- add ~/npm/bin to PATH
after that “npm install -g <pkg>” will install the binary to ~/npm/bin instead of /usr/local/bin
should apply to both “gulp” and “istanbul"
Having cloned fabric-sdk-node, what is the command to generate the documentation ?
<@U1AJV5S2G>  "gulp doc"
Thanks, <@U13TWBRBL>!   I knew it was really simple, just couldn't remember it!
install gulp first with “npm install -g gulp”, may need admin privileges or use the trick I mentioned above to Ramesh to get around that
(don’t know for sure since you are on windows)
given steps worked well for me..
generating html report
Jenkins has a code coverage plugin that supports Istanbul reports, plus keeping track of coverage trends and generates charts
<@U12J2D15H> have you guys been able to work on <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-132> and its children tasks?
want to discuss with you how to bring your work over to the new code base in fabric-sdk-node
yes we are using cobertura coverage report for go sdk tests but that supports xml
will work on this..
<@U13TWBRBL>, I was able to install gulp and generate the documentation, start simpleHTTPServer, and browse it
<@U13TWBRBL>, I am using vlaunch VM instead of vagrant these days unless someone directs me to do otherwise :slightly_smiling_face:
with v1.0 for node.js SDK purposes there’s almost no need for vagrant any longer
unless if you want to build the latest docker images from source
Status = cloned fabric-sdk-node and wrote some issues against it: FAB-750, FAB-749, FAB-748, FAB-747.  I studied a gulp tutorial
